meanings.definition: To propel something through the air with a motion of the arm and hand.
meanings.sent1: I throw the ball to my friend.
meanings.sent2: She likes to throw the frisbee at the park.
meanings.sent3: The monkey learned to throw bananas at the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: His words were like daggers that he could throw at will.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to throw cards into the audience with precision.

meanings.definition: To cause something to fall forcefully or violently.
meanings.sent1: The storm can throw branches off the trees.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake can throw objects off the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The angry chef might throw a plate if the food is not cooked properly.
meanings.sent4: The sudden news can throw a person's emotions into chaos.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected turn of events can throw a plan into disarray.

meanings.definition: To put something in a particular place with force or care.
meanings.sent1: I throw my clothes into the laundry basket after changing.
meanings.sent2: She will throw the keys on the table when she enters the house.
meanings.sent3: The child might throw toys around the room when playing.
meanings.sent4: He decided to throw caution to the wind and take a risk.
meanings.sent5: The artist would throw colors onto the canvas to create a masterpiece.
